items.label: def-relative-entropy
items.title: Relative Entropy and Fisher Information
items.content:
237: :label: def-relative-entropy
238: 
239: For probability measures $\mu, \pi$ on a measurable space $(\mathcal{X}, \mathcal{F})$ with $\mu \ll \pi$, the **relative entropy** (KL-divergence) is:
240: 
241: $$
242: D_{\text{KL}}(\mu \| \pi) := \int \frac{d\mu}{d\pi} \log \frac{d\mu}{d\pi} \, d\pi = \int \log \frac{d\mu}{d\pi} \, d\mu
243: $$
244: 
245: The **entropy** of a density $f$ with respect to $\pi$ is:
246: 
247: $$
248: \text{Ent}_\pi(f) := \int f \log f \, d\pi - \left(\int f \, d\pi\right) \log \left(\int f \, d\pi\right)
249: $$
250: 
251: For a probability density $\rho = d\mu/d\pi$, we have $D_{\text{KL}}(\mu \| \pi) = \text{Ent}_\pi(\rho)$.
252: 
253: The **Fisher information** of $\mu$ with respect to a diffusion generator $\mathcal{L}$ is:
254: 
255: $$
256: I(\mu \| \pi) := \int \left|\nabla \log \frac{d\mu}{d\pi}\right|^2 \frac{d\mu}{d\pi} \, d\pi = 4 \int \left|\nabla \sqrt{\frac{d\mu}{d\pi}}\right|^2 d\pi

items.label: def-lsi-continuous
items.title: Logarithmic Sobolev Inequality (LSI)
items.content:
262: :label: def-lsi-continuous
263: 
264: A probability measure $\pi$ on $\mathbb{R}^d$ with generator $\mathcal{L}$ satisfies a **logarithmic Sobolev inequality** with constant $C_{\text{LSI}} > 0$ if for all smooth functions $f > 0$ with $\int f^2 d\pi = 1$:
265: 
266: $$
267: \text{Ent}_\pi(f^2) \le 2C_{\text{LSI}} \cdot \mathcal{E}(f, f)
268: $$
269: 
270: where $\mathcal{E}(f, f) := -\int f \mathcal{L} f \, d\pi$ is the Dirichlet form.
271: 
272: **Equivalent formulation:** For all $f > 0$:
273: 
274: $$
275: \int f^2 \log f^2 \, d\pi - \left(\int f^2 d\pi\right) \log\left(\int f^2 d\pi\right) \le 2C_{\text{LSI}} \int |\nabla f|^2 \, d\pi

items.label: def-discrete-lsi
items.title: Discrete-Time LSI
items.content:
281: :label: def-discrete-lsi
282: 
283: A Markov kernel $K: \mathcal{X} \to \mathcal{P}(\mathcal{X})$ with invariant measure $\pi$ satisfies a **discrete-time LSI** with constant $C_{\text{LSI}} > 0$ if for all functions $f: \mathcal{X} \to \mathbb{R}_{>0}$:
284: 
285: $$
286: \text{Ent}_\pi(K f^2) \le e^{-\tau/C_{\text{LSI}}} \cdot \text{Ent}_\pi(f^2)
287: $$
288: 
289: where $(Kf)(x) := \int f(y) K(x, dy)$ and $\tau$ is the discrete time step.
290: 
291: **Equivalent formulation via Dirichlet form:** For all $f$:
292: 
293: $$
294: \text{Ent}_\pi(f^2) \le C_{\text{LSI}} \cdot \mathcal{E}_K(f, f)
295: $$

items.label: def-gibbs-kinetic
items.title: Target Gibbs Measure for Kinetic Dynamics
items.content:
562: :label: def-gibbs-kinetic
563: 
564: The **target Gibbs measure** for the kinetic dynamics is:
565: 
566: $$
567: d\pi_{\text{kin}}(x, v) = Z^{-1} \exp\left(-\frac{U(x) + \frac{1}{2}|v|^2}{\theta}\right) dx \, dv
568: $$
569: 
570: where $\theta = \sigma^2/(2\gamma)$ is the temperature (from fluctuation-dissipation theorem) and $Z$ is the normalization constant.
571: 
572: For the harmonic potential:
573: 
574: $$
575: \pi_{\text{kin}} = \mathcal{N}\left(x^*, \frac{\theta}{\kappa} I\right) \otimes \mathcal{N}(0, \theta I)
items.raw_directive:
559: For simplicity, we consider the case $U(x) = \frac{\kappa}{2}|x - x^*|^2$ (harmonic confinement).
560:

items.label: def-hypocoercive-metric
items.title: Hypocoercive Metric and Modified Dirichlet Form
items.content:
589: :label: def-hypocoercive-metric
590: 
591: Following Villani (2009), we define the **hypocoercive metric** via an auxiliary operator
592: 
593: $$
594: A := \nabla_v
595: $$
596: 
597: and coupling parameter $\lambda > 0$. The **modified norm** is:
598: 
599: $$
600: \|f\|_{\text{hypo}}^2 := \|\nabla_v f\|_{L^2(\pi)}^2 + \lambda \|\nabla_x f\|_{L^2(\pi)}^2
601: $$
602: 
603: The **hypocoercive Dirichlet form** is:
604: 
605: $$
606: \mathcal{E}_{\text{hypo}}(f, f) := \|\nabla_v f\|_{L^2(\pi)}^2 + \lambda \|\nabla_x f\|_{L^2(\pi)}^2 + 2\mu \langle \nabla_v f, \nabla_x f \rangle_{L^2(\pi)}
607: $$

items.label: def-log-concavity-condition
items.title: Explicit Log-Concavity Condition
items.content:
1050: :label: def-log-concavity-condition
1051: 
1052: For $\rho_{\text{QSD}}(x) \propto \sqrt{\det g(x)} \cdot \exp(-U_{\text{eff}}(x)/T)$ to be log-concave, we require:
1053: 
1054: $$
1055: \nabla^2 \left[\frac{1}{2}\log(\det g(x)) - \frac{U_{\text{eff}}(x)}{T}\right] \preceq 0
1056: $$
1057: 
1058: (Hessian must be negative semi-definite).
1059: 
1060: **Expanding the terms**:
1061: 
1062: $$
1063: \nabla^2 \log(\rho_{\text{QSD}}) = \frac{1}{2}\nabla^2 \log(\det(H(x) + \epsilon_\Sigma I)) - \frac{1}{T}\nabla^2(U(x) - \epsilon_F V_{\text{fit}}(x))
1064: $$
1065: 
1066: where:
1067: - $H(x) = \nabla^2 V_{\text{fit}}(x)$ is the Hessian of the fitness potential
1068: - $V_{\text{fit}}(x)$ itself depends on reward $r(x)$ and swarm density via complex integral

5905: ### 3.2. The Discrete Status-Change Metric
5906: 
5907: :::{prf:definition} Discrete Status-Change Metric
5908: :label: def-status-metric
5909: 
5910: For two swarm states $\mathcal{S}_1, \mathcal{S}_2$ with the same number of walkers $N$, define:
5911: 
5912: $$
5913: d_{\text{status}}(\mathcal{S}_1, \mathcal{S}_2) := n_c(\mathcal{S}_1, \mathcal{S}_2)
5914: $$
5915: 
5916: where $n_c$ is the **number of status changes**: the number of walker indices $i$ where walker $i$ has different alive/dead status in the two swarms.
5917: 
5918: Equivalently, if $\mathbf{s}_1, \mathbf{s}_2 \in \{\text{alive}, \text{dead}\}^N$ are the status vectors:
5919: 
5920: $$
5921: d_{\text{status}}(\mathcal{S}_1, \mathcal{S}_2) = \|\mathbf{s}_1 - \mathbf{s}_2\|_0 = \sum_{i=1}^N \mathbb{1}[\mathbf{s}_{1,i} \neq \mathbf{s}_{2,i}]
